physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Conjunctival injection, icterus, subconjunctival hemorrhages, 2+ bilateral pedal edema, soft abdomen without tenderness or guarding.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Capillary blood glucose between 30 to 39 mg/dL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Unresponsive on examination by EMS personnel.
Skin jaundiced, conjunctivae hyperemic, distended abdome, normal tenderness, 1+ peripheral edema. Mental status was only oriented to self.
Confusion, increasing lethargy, non-radiating mid-abdominal pain, vomiting, splenomegaly noted (19.5 cm).
Bilateral subconjunctival hemorrhages, diffuse jaundice, soft abdomen with normal bowel sounds and mild tenderness, no distention or palpable spleen.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual improvement after normal saline infusion, albumin and red cell transfusion.
